data.message: So after a 30 day block every time you get reported it's a 30 day block! I know I didn't violate... 30 days is excessive especially with all the vulgarity on Fb

replies.message: Hi Karen. It sounds like you may have over-used a feature, even if you didn't mean to. Hold tight until you can access the feature again. In the meantime, you can learn more about our policies by reviewing the Facebook Community Standards: http://bit.ly/2rUSA7q. -Jessica

Facebook My page has been deleted, I have no reason provided as to why.. and my messages on the help board and directly to Facebook have gone with out a response.  I did not violate the policies as I have read and reread them several times. I continue to see posts that share the same information that I was sharing.  Please explain.

Hi Emily. Sometimes, we place limits on Pages that don't follow the Facebook Pages Terms: http://bit.ly/2qZZN21. For example, Pages that publish spam may be unpublished. If you believe your Page received limits by mistake, the best way to reach our team is by clicking Appeal below the limit's description at the top of your Page. -Jessica
Facebook and you unfairly block people's pages because they had people to disagree with the content even though it wasn't vulgar at all.  I know it happened to one of my favorite pages.
They still didn't answer the escalations of reporting. Once you get a 30 day block you get it every time you're reported. I didn't violate the standards I was just reported !
I did this, there was no spam. There was no response. My page was deleted.
